body:
Concept ACK

I think you can fix [this CI failure](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25152/checks?check_run_id=6474951925) with:

```diff
diff --git a/src/Makefile.am b/src/Makefile.am
index 3d6143d1ee..d06e51852e 100644
--- a/src/Makefile.am
+++ b/src/Makefile.am
@@ -923,6 +923,7 @@ libbitcoinkernel_la_SOURCES = \
   util/rbf.cpp \
   util/serfloat.cpp \
   util/settings.cpp \
+  util/shell.cpp \
   util/strencodings.cpp \
   util/string.cpp \
   util/syscall_sandbox.cpp \
```

Thanks @dongcarl - I've got some issues to figure out, particularly on the `WIN32` side, and I'll be doing it via CI so it's going to mean some back and forth on this PR. E.g. the change is 5 commits but I'm going to have to play them out one by one to validate them.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26812](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26812) (test: add end-to-end tests for CConnman and PeerManager by vasild)
* [#26720](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26720) (wallet: coin selection, don't return results that exceed the max allowed weight by furszy)
* [#26715](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26715) (Introduce `MockableDatabase` for wallet unit tests by achow101)
* [#26690](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26690) (wallet: Refactor database cursor into its own object with proper return codes by achow101)
* [#26654](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26654) (util: Show descriptive error messages when FileCommit fails by john-moffett)
* [#26504](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26504) (Add `UNREACHABLE` macro and drop `-Wreturn-type`/`C4715` warnings suppressions by hebasto)
* [#26226](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26226) (Bump minimum python version to 3.7 by MarcoFalke)
* [#26177](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26177) (refactor / kernel: Move non-gArgs chainparams functionality to kernel by TheCharlatan)
* [#25390](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25390) (sync: introduce a thread-safe generic container and use it to remove a bunch of "GlobalMutex"es by vasild)
* [#24914](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24914) (wallet: Load database records in a particular order by achow101)
* [#24545](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24545) (BIP324: Enable v2 P2P encrypted transport by dhruv)
* [#24479](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24479) (Bugfix: util: Correctly handle Number value types in GetArg/GetBoolArg by luke-jr)
* [#24128](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24128) (wallet: BIP 326 sequence based anti-fee-snipe for taproot inputs by MarcoFalke)
* [#23561](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23561) (BIP324: Handshake prerequisites by dhruv)
* [#22341](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22341) (rpc: add getxpub by Sjors)
* [#19463](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19463) (Prune locks by luke-jr)
* [#16545](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16545) (refactor: Implement missing error checking for ArgsManager flags by ryanofsky)
* [#15294](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15294) (refactor: Extract RipeMd160 by Empact)
* [#14485](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14485) (Try to use posix_fadvise with CBufferedFile by luke-jr)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

AFAICT the build failures are coming from including these lines and I don't think they are needed, so I'm guessing this was included to debug a windows problem? I'm keen on moving this PR forward,. Is there some deeper problem here with running this patch on windows, or is it a compile-time issue?
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,64 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2009-2010 Satoshi Nakamoto
+// Copyright (c) 2009-2022 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#include <util/shell.h>
+
+#if defined(HAVE_CONFIG_H)
+#include <config/bitcoin-config.h>
+#endif
+
+#ifdef ENABLE_EXTERNAL_SIGNER
+#if defined(__GNUC__)
+// Boost 1.78 requires the following workaround.
+// See: https://github.com/boostorg/process/issues/235
+#pragma GCC diagnostic push
+#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wnarrowing"
+#endif
+#include <boost/process.hpp>
+#include <memory>
+#include <ostream>
+#include <vector>
+#if defined(__GNUC__)
+#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
+#endif
+#endif // ENABLE_EXTERNAL_SIGNER

body:
In f12cd1d77bc062f1313f98a8aaea8afd96c4f52e:
Why is compat being included here? if it's for a `windows.h` include (which isn't in compat anyways), then I'd rather we just include `windows.h`.
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2009-2010 Satoshi Nakamoto
+// Copyright (c) 2009-2022 The Bitcoin Core developers
+// Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#include <util/exception.h>
+
+#include <logging.h>
+#include <tinyformat.h>
+
+#include <iostream>
+#include <typeinfo>
+
+#ifdef WIN32
+#include <compat/compat.h>

body:
in e5243d3676136e4b0a590e76a07c86e62ca7d1f7:
>  and I don't think they are needed,

Yea, there is no Boost usage in this file (and is no-longer any in the util library), so the entire `ENABLE_EXTERNAL_SIGNER` chunk here should be removed.

This seems unrelated to this commit, and is not mentioned in the commit message.

ð This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

I redid this work (fixing more of the includes and splitting out a few more functions) and have a branch over here: https://github.com/TheCharlatan/bitcoin/pull/10

@Empact I'm still keen on moving this work forward. If you don't have the time right now, I'll attribute the commits to you and try to get my branch merged instead.

> I'm still keen on moving this work forward. If you don't have the time right now, I'll attribute the commits to you and try to get my branch merged instead.

Yep, it would be good to start getting some of this merged.
Going to close this for now, given that it's being split out, and there's a [thumbs up from the author above](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25152#issuecomment-1458326647).
